text: Brad Stephen "Taylor" Negron (August 1, 1957 - January 10, 2015) was an American writer, actor, painter, and stand-up comedian. His best known movies were Fast Times at Ridgemont High (1982), The Last Boy Scout (1991), Angels in the Outfield (1994), Bio-Dome (1996), and Stuart Little (1999). He appeared in television shows such as Wizards of Waverly Place, Fresh Prince of Bel Air, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Reno 911, Friends, My Wife and Kids, Seinfeld, ER, and Party of Five. Negron was born in Glendale, California. He grew up in La Ca√±ada Flintridge, California. He was of Puerto Rican ancestry. He was also the cousin of singer Chuck Negron. He was openly gay. Negron died from liver cancer on January 10, 2015 in Los Angeles. He was 57. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1957 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from Glendale, California Category:LGBT people from California Category:American movie actors Category:American painters Category:American stand-up comedians Category:American television actors Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:Comedians from Los Angeles County, California Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT artists Category:LGBT comedians Category:American LGBT writers Category:Writers from Los Angeles County, California
title: Taylor Negron
